newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunis Air has new boss.
newsitem.headline: Tunis Air has new boss.

text.p: Ahmed Smaoui has been named chairman of Tunisian airline Tunis Air, an official statement said on Saturday.
Smaoui, a former transport and tourism minister, was chairman of the state-run railways company Societe Nationale des Chemins de Fer Tunisiens (SNCFT) where he is replaced by Ali Sheikh Khalfallah.
Tunis Air in 1995 sold 20 percent of its capital for 32 million dinars in the biggest sell off in Tunisia's privatisation programme so far. An additional sell off is planned for 1997.
